intro: Lessertia pubescens, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, are pollinated by insects and birds. Lessertia pubescens is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
